name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Text on the card:
I’m sorry, my child, a Shenzhener.
Rest in peace, my child, a Chinese.
I’m sorry, my child, please rest in peace - a Shenzhen mother
Child: Don’t cry, don’t be afraid, your aunt will protect you!

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Netizens discovered that on the website of the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the sentence "Do you think such incidents are isolated incidents?" in a question asked by a reporter from Japan's Kyodo News Agency was deleted.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 19, a man who went to the scene to send flowers and mourn told reporters that "this is the result of long-term persistence in hate education."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Israel's Mossad's attack was not limited to pagers. This time, bombs were installed on Hezbollah members' motorcycles, walkie-talkies, radios, sofas, cars, solar panels and even tables and toilets.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the evening of September 19, it was reported online that a small sea of flowers appeared in front of the Shenzhen Japanese School after a girl argued for it.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
“🤡”
On September 19, Guancha.com published an article stating that “hate speech” is not allowed on any online platform in China, let alone so-called “hate propaganda”. Raising extreme individual cases to “universal social problems” and “institutional mechanisms” is an excuse for the crime.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 19, Shenzhen. Citizens have been spontaneously coming to the scene to offer flowers and mourn. A merchant said: "We have delivered more than a dozen orders today, and there are still "cards behind them, most of which say "I'm sorry, a Chinese from somewhere"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In the early morning of September 20, all the flowers in front of the Shenzhen Japanese School had been cleared away. Security guards and plainclothes officers were stationed around the school.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the evening of September 19, students from Xi'an Information Vocational University once again took to the building to protest because the school was closed from Monday to Friday.
